Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misidentification of the person in the photograph.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the person in the photograph is not Derek Chauvin but Jonathan Riches.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the person wearing the "Make Whites Great Again" hat is Derek Chauvin, which is incorrect.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests an alternative explanation that the slogan on the hat was photoshopped, as claimed by Jonathan Riches.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the photograph by associating it with the controversial slogan and implying it is connected to Derek Chauvin.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times bias in the provided claim.
